title: COVID-19 Detection Using Segmentation, Region Extraction and Classification Pipeline. (arXiv:2210.02992v3 [eess.IV] UPDATED)
abstract: The main purpose of this study is to develop a pipeline for COVID-19 detection from a big and challenging database of Computed Tomography (CT) images. The proposed pipeline includes a segmentation part, a lung extraction part, and a classifier part. Optional slice removal techniques after UNet-based segmentation of slices were also tried. The methodologies tried in the segmentation part are traditional segmentation methods as well as UNet-based methods. In the classification part, a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) was used to take the final diagnosis decisions. In terms of the results: in the segmentation part, the proposed segmentation methods show high dice scores on a publicly available dataset. In the classification part, the results were compared at slice-level and at patient-level as well. At slice-level, methods were compared and showed high validation accuracy indicating efficiency in predicting 2D slices. At patient level, the proposed methods were also compared in terms of
tldr: 本研究旨在开发一种用于从大型具有挑战性的计算机断层扫描（CT）图像数据库中检测COVID-19的流程。该流程包括分割部分、肺部提取部分和分类器部分。在分割部分中，尝试了传统分割方法和基于UNet的方法。在分类部分中，使用卷积神经网络（CNN）进行最终诊断决策。在结果方面，所提出的分割方法在公开可用的数据集上显示出高的Dice分数。在分类部分，方法在切片级别和患者级别进行了比较，并显示出高的验证准确性，表明其在预测2D切片方面的效率。
en_tldr: This study aims to develop a pipeline for detecting COVID-19 from a large and challenging database of Computed Tomography (CT) images. The proposed pipeline includes a segmentation part, a lung extraction part, and a classifier part. The segmentation part tried traditional segmentation methods as well as UNet-based methods. In the classification part, a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) was used to make final diagnosis decisions. The proposed segmentation methods showed high dice scores on a publicly available dataset. The methods were compared at slice-level and at patient-level, and showed high validation accuracy in predicting 2D slices.
